summary: This document is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney summarizing a conversation with Larry Visoski regarding his contacts with Customs and Border Protection (CBP) personnel and their relationships with Jeffrey Epstein. It details how Epstein cultivated relationships with CBP officials to facilitate smoother travel and potentially offered them rides on his aircraft.

persons.name: Larry Visoski
persons.context: Epstein's pilot who was asked about his contacts with CBP personnel, including Bill Rouch. He described how Epstein directed him to exchange numbers with CBP officials.

persons.name: Bill Rouch
persons.context: A CBP officer whose contact number was found in Larry Visoski's phone. Visoski had familiarity with his photo but no specific recollection of contact.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure who cultivated relationships with CBP officials, directed his pilot to exchange numbers with them, and offered them rides on his plane and helicopter to facilitate smoother travel.

persons.name: James Heil
persons.role: Head of CBP in St. Thomas
persons.context: Described as head of CBP in St. Thomas and a friend of Jeffrey Epstein. He and Jeff McNally would not give Epstein a hard time during customs inspections.

persons.name: Jeff McNally
persons.context: A CBP officer who had a relationship with Jeffrey Epstein and, along with James Heil, would not delay him during customs. Visoski may have given him a ride in the helicopter.

persons.name: Glenn Samuel
persons.context: A customs agent who befriended Jeffrey Epstein, played steel drums, and was potentially picked up by Epstein's boat to come to the island.

connections.description: Epstein directed his pilot Visoski to exchange contact numbers with CBP officials to facilitate travel.
Described as friends; Heil as head of CBP in St. Thomas would not give Epstein a hard time during customs.
Had a relationship where McNally would not delay Epstein during customs inspections.
Epstein befriended the customs agent, who played steel drums, and may have sent a boat to pick him up.
Visoski had Rouch's contact number in his phone, likely obtained at Epstein's direction, but has no specific recollection of contact.

events.title: Interview with Larry Visoski
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney summarizes a conversation with Epstein's pilot, Larry Visoski, regarding his contacts with CBP personnel and their relationships with Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein cultivated relationships with multiple Customs and Border Protection (CBP) officials, including James Heil (head of CBP in St. Thomas), Jeff McNally, and Glenn Samuel, to facilitate smoother travel and avoid delays.
Epstein directed his pilot, Larry Visoski, to exchange contact numbers with CBP officials, and Visoski had Bill Rouch's number in his phone as a result.
Epstein frequently offered rides on his plane and helicopter to CBP officials, and may have sent a boat to pick up agent Glenn Samuel to bring him to the island.
